info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 3:00PM EDT until May 16 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Hamilton County in eastern New York... Western Fulton County in eastern New York... Southern Herkimer County in eastern New York... Northwestern Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 300 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Holland Patent to near Frankfort to near Richfield Springs, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Frankfort, Fort Plain, Dolgeville, St. Johnsville, Ephratah, Ohio, Newport, Stratford, Middleville, Poland, Cold Brook, Jordanville, Caroga Lake, Caroga Lake Public Campground and Northwood. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
